intro: Stachytarpheta rupestris, commonly known as the rock sage or rock verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Stachytarpheta rupestris is often used in landscaping for its hardiness and ornamental value.
